segment.source: Provides guides for porting your existing games to Direct3D 11, Universal Windows Platform (UWP), and Windows 10.

segment.source: Provides guides for porting your existing games to Direct3D 11, Universal Windows Platform (UWP), and Windows 10.
segment.target: Provides guides for porting your existing games to Direct3D 11, Universal Windows Platform (UWP), and Windows 10.

segment.source: Port from DirectX 9 to Universal Windows Platform
segment.target: Port from DirectX 9 to Universal Windows Platform

segment.source: This section includes articles, overviews, and walkthroughs for porting DirectX 9 games to UWP.
segment.target: This section includes articles, overviews, and walkthroughs for porting DirectX 9 games to UWP.

segment.source: Port from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.1
segment.target: Port from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.1

segment.source: Includes articles, overviews, and walkthroughs for porting an OpenGL ES 2.0 graphics pipeline to a Direct3D 11 and the Windows Runtime.
segment.target: Includes articles, overviews, and walkthroughs for porting an OpenGL ES 2.0 graphics pipeline to a Direct3D 11 and the Windows Runtime.

segment.source: Note This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: Note This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the archived documentation.
